description:
Great part of the wharf food stalls, you can get all kinds of fried seafood here. While it's not fried up as you wait (it was under a hot lamp), the seasoning and breading was just right and crisp with the shrimp being big and fresh. The curly fries were fantastic, too.

Counters are dirty, but they are standing-room only. We took ours and ate it while walking the wharf.
author: Hank C.

description:
If you want quick food and you're on the go , this place is for you . Can't promise you it's amazing though because it's not. 

Wanted a quick bite to eat and there was a strip of vendors by the pier. Decided to look around and we ended up at The Crab Station. 

Lobster Roll $22.95 : This was delicious. ( Or maybe I was just hungry ) But it had Huge chunks of lobster on top of seafood salad inside the roll . It was missing lemon though.4/5

Calarami / Fried Shrimp : This was such a disappointment. They gave me burnt pieces of shrimp and it had a nasty flavor I couldn't even eat it . The calamari was also not appetizing . Some pieces weren't salted and not cooked all the way I can taste the mushy batter. Such a waste of calories. 1/5 

The customer service here is also horrible. Waited in line and didn't get acknowledged and they were trying to take someone else's order when I arrived first -__- 

If you're looking to be satisfied just stick to the lobster roll or keep it moving .
author: Elle F.

description:
We saw that the main parking validated for these little restaurants & I wanted to try something different cause we always go to Boudin's. 
I tried the clam chowder....
2/5
It was definitely not thick at all, rather watery and flavorless. I had to put a grip of salt and pepper packets to fix it up 
Good chowder should be thick, creamy and something you don't have to doctor up. 
The service was pretty whatever cause it was pretty busy, it was a Saturday night. The counters were dirty as well, again maybe cause it has been busy. 
Glad I got to venture off outside the safe world of Boudin's but I'll never try that chowder again.lol.
author: Julliette S.

description: Looking for a quick seafood catch on the fisherman's wharf? Look no farther than The Crab Station! Less than $7 for a fried crab cake (delicious) and fries, loved it!!
author: Zach H.

description: Great menu and selection of foods. We ordered a host of items. Fast service, tasty food, and a good feel of the Wharf. Sidewalk ordering and a small metal table to eat, but that is all of the experience. I'll be back when in the area. Pic posted.
author: George C.

description: Probably the best clam chowder I had on this trip! They were quick and I really like the thickness of the chowder. It's right in the middle of everything so you can really enjoy the vibe of the wharf. The bread bowl was about $9. Next time I'm here, I would probably just get the soup as the bread was a little hard to eat.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Well, this time in lew of breaking my "Milestone SF Reviews" I choose to make "The Crab Station" review #301. Why did I make this choice? Well my good friend "Shayla B" suggested I change things up a bit, so I did. I honestly am glad I didn't choose this spot as a "milestone" as I feel it wasn't.."special" it was just okay. But I'm glad that I did finally get to come and see what this place was about. The buzz about this place from the opinions of others in the "Yelpire" have been pretty mixed. Now it's my turn to tell you how I felt about "The Crab Station"

Tuesday April 3, 2018
Location: The Crab Station, San Francisco Can
People: 1 Adult

Story:
I been trying to knock out my bookmarks one by one. I was in the mood for something different. It was a nice sunny day out in SF and I was walking along all the piers. I was passing by a lot of places I had my eye on, but nothing really stood out to me. I decided to look through my bookmarks as I was on my stroll, the funny part of it all is "The Crab Station" was highlighted by "Yelp" this day and I was thinking about this establishment. Call it "Devine Intervention" I made up my mind and set off.

Service/Hospitality:
The service here was honestly pretty standard. I was greeted and allowed to look at the menu for a bit. Later when I got my food one of the workers helped bring my food to the seating area which I thought was cool. Nothing else to mention during this whole interaction.

Food/Cleanliness:
The counter/food area was tidy and presentable, I felt okay about ordering here. The small seating area could of used a slight more attention to detail though. It was pretty cramped and they wasn't quick to clear out trays and such from other visitors. This area could of used some work, but now let's talk about the food. I of course wanted the star of the show "The Lobster Roll" $22.95 and with the delicious smells and look of the "Calamari" $12.21 and a Kiwi Strawberry Snapple $4.00, I pretty much had what seemed to be the popular options, here is what I thought..

Lobster Roll - I like this, I wasn't in love with it honestly. Basically this is lobster salad with 2 claws split and put on the top of the roll. A hell of a lot of mayo was used in making this, but the flavor was present. I wasn't a fan of the roll used as I would of liked a French Roll and felt it would of been better. I ate this and felt it wasn't fully worth the price, maybe perhaps a few dollars cheaper would of been more worth it. Also slightly less mayo so more of the lobster could of been more front and center. I would still get this again.

Calamari - I wasn't blown away with this nither. It was just okay at best. I liked the little pieces with the tentacles as it was less chewy and more flavorful than the actual rings. I opted for the full plate and ditched the fries for a slight upcharge and the portion was good. It was nicely battered and not super greasy. I would say this is a to each is their own kinda thing. I would skip this unless I could get all the little tentacle pieces.

Snapple - Kiwi Strawberry, if you've had it.... it's just juice.

Overall:
This is a family decent establishment with some fresh seafood offerings. The prices are pretty competitive and what better than eating a "Lobster Roll" in "San Francisco" it just has that authentic feeling especially considering it's in a touristy area and the SF air adding that beach like quality to the experience. I would visit again, but not before visiting a competitor for a little compare and contrast.
author: Tre S.

description: Whole Dungeness crab is super fresh. The lobster roll is super loaded however it's not served on the big buttered toast I'm used to from other places I've had lobster rolls from in the peninsula. I will say the lobster roll is a great value since so far it's the cheapest (and most loaded) lobster roll I've tried in the Bay Area. The clam chowder is also pretty good! You will order either at the sidewalk cart outside or in the small seating area inside. This has seating in in a small storefront and service is pretty good as they will serve you your food to  your table. You can ask for extra condiments or lemons and they can bring it to your table.
author: Darlene V.

description:
Wandered around in the fisherman's wharf area looking for seafood. Wasn't feeling anything in particular so I decided to see what stands offered.

Most of the food stands had fried seafood, seafood sandwich and clam chowder. I decided to go with the chowder to since a lot of people suggested it.

It was definitely good, but I didn't think that it stood out as amazing/SF unique compared to other chowders that I had. I got a breadbowl, and it came out to be around $9 + tax.

No seating since this is just a food stand essentially, but if you walk closer to the waters, there's a bunch of picnic style benches/tables by the arcade - just beware of the seagulls!
author: Daniel Z.

description:
Walked by this stand and decided to give them a try.

They offer all sorts of seafood and it's all laid out for you to choose. The cashier was quick and friendly. Ordered some fried shrimp and clam chowder to go. There is no seating by the stand. They also have a small restaurant behind the stand, with little seating. Depending on what time you go, it can get packed quickly. I enjoyed the fried shrimp but it was a bit light on the seasoning. It didn't taste all that fresh either, it may have been sitting there for awhile. Their clam chowder was good, it was flavorful. I wouldn't say this was my favorite place to get clam chowder in the area, but I'm glad we got a chance to try The Crab Station out.
author: Kimberly J.

description: Don't even mess around. Get the lobster roll and the fried calamari. It all pairs nicely with an Anchor Steam beer. There is extremely limited seating right behind the stand, you can wait until people finish then swoop in on their spot. Service is friendly. Definitely a little divey, but oh so worth it. My husband and I try to come back each time we're in the SF area.
author: Crystal R.

description: I didn't get to try any of the food because the rude Asian lady kept helping other people.  Also, customers that didn't "appear" well dressed she proceeded to tell them the price, very insulting in my opinion!  There were other stands there that were more deserving of your hard earned money and business, give them a shot.
author: Alex K.

description:
We decided on this little spot after walking Fishermans Wharf. They serve pretty good food at a decent price. The line wasn't too bad and after ordering they have you walk across to pay on the other side were you could sit down. A group was getting off the table and we sat there pretty quick as well. It was very crowded with people trying to get seats.

I ordered the bread bowl clam chowder and everyone else in my party ordered the lobster roll. I tried half of the lobster roll and it was pretty good. The clam chowder was also good and I definitely enjoyed it. I thought the price for it was a lot, but I guess it's because it's real lobster. Our bill for 3 lobster rolls, 1 clam chowder, and 3 drinks came put to $79.51. 

The staff was nice and very helpful trying to get your orders out as fast as possible. If I do come back I'll definitely try something else.
author: Karen C.

description: We stopped by and ordered some crab cake. It ended up we got the imitation crab cake. Most likely lots of breading and fake crab meat. Do not recommended this place. Very disappointed.
author: Penwarat S.

description: Lobster roll lobster roll lobster roll!!! If you are a local or you are simply visiting you must try the lobster roll. It's huge it could feed about three people honestly. I would be weary about their fried shrimp I saw them bring in like Costco size boxes with pre-made shrimp. Additionally there clam chowder is not authentic either it comes canned. But the lobster is fresh and well worth the $20
author: Shawneshia H.

description:
Usually after a long day of wandering the streets of this gorgeous city, my hubby and I like to enjoy a nice sit down dinner at some 'fancy' restaurant. 
This day however, we wanted to do something different...something we hadn't tried before.  
We wanted to get down to some serious, seafood business. Now, I had heard tales of the stands just past the "touristy pier"... pier 39... that sold fresh crab they'd boil in pots, right there on the street, Lobster rolls, clam chowder in sour dough bowls, and plenty of fried seafood. 
I had to try it!
After seeing all we could possibly see in one day, we headed towards the boiling pots of crab! Ok, sooooo now that I know and have been informed that the lobster here isn't fresh west coast hahahhaa but that the crab is... I definitely feel I should have tried the crab rather than the lobster roll...oh well, next time for sure!
Speaking on what I did order, the lobster roll was actually pretty darn fantastic in my book! We ordered a Lobster Roll, Clam Chowder in Sourdough and fried Calamari.
WowZa. The lobster roll was what appeared to be a mixture of a fresh crab and lobster, (so I think I did get my crab) topped with huge chunks of lobster meat. I asked for melted butter and lemon. It came on a sourdough roll which I LOVE sourdough.
The calamari were HUGE, and tasted super fresh and not rubbery at all. Idk where they get their calamari but it's beautiful. The clam chowder was good. I think it could have been thicker..but hubby loved it. Finnally the portions are HUGE! You get a ton of food so be prepared to eat!
We sat at a table, under the stars on the street and people watched for awhile, eating happily and then left the city for home. I actually can't wait to go back and get another Lobster Roll, and this time try the crab, this place rocked our socks.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Visited touristy Fishermen's Wharf and based on a fair amount of Google reviews I thought that The Crab Station would be a decent spot along the wharf for a Lobster Roll. 

Keep in mind that every single vendor out there sells pre-made lobster rolls. They are all sitting in chilled display cases.  Note, I've never had a lobster roll before so this is the closest to it without traveling to the New England. 

The roll came to almost $23 with a can of soda. After I paid the cashier he took a roll out of their cold case. They had about 10 already made. 

1) The roll is cold, a bit hard. It is sour dough. Not toasted. 
2) The roll was loaded with claw meat and other body meats mixed with a heavy mayo sauce?
3) Takes a lot of chewing to the point where my jaw was tired. Thankfully I ordered a Coke to down each bite.
4) Seating is limited. I ordered outside where they boil their crabs. They have some seats right inside. The tables were dirty and not wiped. I cleaned the table myself. 

Yeah it was quite disappointing first experience. The roll wasn't disgusting but not something I would pay or order again, especially at $20 for a sandwich.
author: Robert N.

description: The boss is very rude and impolite, the food is very expensive but eat like shxx.
author: 益葳

description: The chowder is food the staff though is a different story. It's not as if they have a lot if people in line it was just us and it was early in the morning when we came by. Was really disappointed with how we got treated.
author: Maricar D.

description:
This place is very good for Fisherman's Wharf! If you are not a crazy picky yelper with exquisite palate, you will like this place. I enjoyed it, food looks great on photos, is tasty, you can eat right in front of the Fisherman's Wharf sign and move on with your adventures. 

The lobster roll and the bowl were around $30 total. Pricy, but again this is San Francisco and this is a touristy spot.
author: Sasha Z.

description:
So yummy & decent prices! Highly recommend the lobster roll, crab cakes & clam chowder. It's very busy & crowded, you can order your food & eat on the indoor tables behind, seats are limited, or get it to go.

Tip- the bread bowl was only ok, for a dollar more, I would recommend getting the pint or quart size clam chowder & share with the family.
author: Victoria S.

description: Only thing I can say is don't buy the frozen seafood. Get the fresh meaty boiled crab. It is so fresh and you will never regret. The crab were so fresh that you don't even need any lemon or cocktail sauce. However I suggest not to eat in as the store is very dirty.
author: Albert S.

description: My friends and I were local around the city and wanted to act like tourists. Should've known not to read some of the reviews on here. I know my good lobster roll and this place is gross. Once we got to this place, it was the worst lobster roll we ever tasted. It was very dry, not warmed up, and the mayonnaise was overpowering. I felt like puking... I had to use  a lot of lemons, but it did not work out so great. My other two friends did not like it either. We were all disappointed. Waste of money. Go to the lobster place in Burlingame. Best roll there and fresh made on the spot once you order.
author: April M.

description: This place has great crab cakes. Everything was fresh tasty and delicious. I love this spot too because the prices are very reasonable. I will definitely order here again next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: MaVie M.

description: If I can give this place NO stars, I would! We usually try Chowders and we decided to try a new place. Worst idea ever! The clam chowder had a weird taste, the battered shrimp and fish was super hard, the fries were hard! My husband requested new fries for my son because he couldn't bite into them. We will NEVER eat here again and I highly recommend no one else does either!
author: Aracely R.

description:
We liked it. It's hard to pick which restaurant to go to in this section of fisherman's wharf as they all look the same

We randomly chose this one. They were nice. And you can sit down at a table behind the area where they sell food out front

We had the clam chowder in the bowl. It was very good. But you didn't get quite as much as you do at Boudin as we had a lot of bread left over and the soup was all gone.
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Food was pretty good I got the two item with fish shrimp and fries. Nice atmosphere. Be prepared to stand an eat.
Great vibes
author: Elisha A.

description: This restaurant is run by chinese people, support alipay and wechat. Quite fresh and taste good.
author: Shan G.

description:
This place is always super crackin whenever I come by the wharf. 

The calamari and other fried items are just ok... kinda chewy but I looove the clam chowder and fried shrimp!!! Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The sauce it comes with is yummy too. Staff here are pretty efficient and nice.
author: Shana N.

description:
do not come here they use campbells canned soup the cashier even told me and then turnes his back on me 
do not come here 
theyre a scam
a disgrace to the city
author: Fatima A.

description:
Stopped by for some crab meat
Cocktail, calamari and chips and clam chowder. I first purchased my fried foods outside from the vendor before getting lucky enough to get a seat inside the actual restaurant

Service outside is good and they are very helpful with recommending items from the menu. Only drawback is there is no seating and you'll eat standing up. 

Seating is limited in the restaurant and the service isn't too great. Waitresses seemed impatient and didn't answer much of my questions. 

I ordered:

Crabmeat cocktail: delicious and fresh crab meat with cocktail sauce 

Calamari and chips: heavily breaded and chew calamari pieces. I didn't really enjoy this very much 

Clam chowder in bread bowl: not all clam chowder is created equal!! It lacked flavor and was full of potatoes! I wish I stuck with my gut instinct and walked over to Boudins bakery for the legit clam chowder. 

For a quick meal while standing I'd say head there. If you have the time, sample some of the foods from the vendors and head to boudin for real SF calm chowder
author: Nicole Y.

description: Multiple crab stations lined up side by side outside across the big fisherman's wharf sign. Went to station #2 crab station. You order outside and right across you can eat in their high chairs and tables. Delicious food. Get the lobster roll. All lobster with some white sauce which I think could be mayo on a sourdough roll. Mmmm..I could go for more!
author: Vanessa G.

description: My go-to spot when taking visiting guests to SF interesting in fresh Dungeness crab. Better food than many of the fancy restaurants nearby.  Ultra-casual, no view, fast service.  Given the experience they are trying to create, the result is good.
author: Carlos D.

description: I went here yesterday while I was in San Francisco with friends. We were craving for some fresh seafood and what the best place for fresh seafood? Fisherman wharf! Of course! Lol. We went to the popular local stand by the sign fisherman wharf. It kind of busy when we went there. I ordered a fresh crab and clam chowder. My friend ordered fried calamari. The services was pretty fast and good. We were on the go since we had to head in a bit to catch our flight back to OC. We took our food to go and finally got to eat it when we got home. The crab was very delicious and fresh. It was boiled and does not need any seasoning or flavoring. The calamari didn't taste as good when it was fried but later on when it not hot it tastes a lot of better. The clam chowder was decent. There was fresh lobster as well and others seafood that I didn't get to try. The food can be a bit pricey but it worth since it fresh and good. Parking can be hard since it a tourist spot so best to park further and walk. I will be back for the other seafood when I'm in the area since I didn't get to try those food.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
Ordered calamari & chips.  Comes with marinara sauce in a small container.  Totally tasteless on its own. Coating was soggy, not crispy at all. We threw 1/3 away once we got a  crab sandwich from Boudin

What a waste of calories!!! :O

The Asian guy who was taking our order also looked like he's reluctant to make a sale. Never am I going to bring anyone to this pad ever again.  There's so many others to eat from
author: Sonia F.

description:
I've been here more than a dozen times and have always ordered the exact same thing. Their crab sandwich. It is THE BEST IN SF, guaranteed by me. I've tried many crab sandwiches, all over sf, and this small, unassuming stand makes the best sf has to offer. 
They give you a fork because they load the sandwich so full you have to eat it with a fork before you can eat it like a sandwich. It's also pretty cheap too.
author: Colton F.

description: Always a pleasure coming here! There's something special about this place. They ALWAYS have the freshest crabs here, almost tastes if it they caught it 5 min ago. The sauce that comes w the fresh crab is also so fleeeeeeky. Its one of the best coctail sauces I have ever tasted (it's like a traditional sauce but spicy and peppery). If you are ever at the farmers wharf crab station is the way to go!!
author: Christie V.

description:
Clam chowder here is delicious but honestly tastes just like the other stands near by...

The crab cake was way overpriced for a single small crab cake :(

I've been here plenty of times and it's consistent. I hear that people have seen them use the cans? If so, that sucks. But it sure tastes good in the cold SF air!
author: Donna D.

description:
It was ok this time around. First time we went the crab sandwiches were amazing. This time around there was just crab and mayo, very bland. Bread was very good. 

Mind you it's not crab season so it's not super surprising that most of the crab on the strip isn't great. That being said, I got the popcorn shrimp and didn't get to try it because a effing seagull literally ATTACKED me for the shrimp.
author: Gauri V.

description: Awesome stop for calamari n' chips and shrimp n' chips. It's a must go to for our trips to San Francisco
author: vannica s.

description: This place is the face of the San Francisco Fishermans Wharf. If you tale a look at what they have, you'll want everything! The only thing is its pretty expensive. The restaurant part is across the walk way. Kinda dirty, they dont wipe tables after people finish eating. Cant complain too much, its more of an outdoor restaurant type where fresh seafood us available. Hard 3 but still irresistible.
author: Edwardson S.

description: Meh it was okay. I was really expecting for that delicious, buttery, and delectable taste of the sea but instead was given crab/shrimp that tasted better only if eaten with cocktail sauce. It didn't hurt to try it though. Prices were reasonable. I prefer just going elsewhere to get your seafood. If you're really hungry and craving something small then this is good. I didn't care much for the shrimp. It was a little on the rubbery side, but other than that, this place is average. Better yet going home and making your own seafood cocktail medley.
author: Christal C.

description: Great cheap clam strips on the street stand.  I asked for no chips & plenty of clams for 2 of us.  Food wasn't overly hot but they were tasty
author: Just K.

description: OLD AND GROSS-fish & chips tasted like it had been recycled from the day before. Chips or rather curly fries were old and crusty. They also wouldn't let us take the bottle of malt vinegar to the table -I guess we were going to run away with it?!! Just NOT GOOD AT ALL! Save yourself time and money and buy fish sticks from the store.
author: Marisa D.

description:
I guest i expected more out of a Lobster Roll which I orderd but I did not experience the WOW effect that I needed or wanted to come back. 

I ordered a Lobster Roll and I was expecting a fresh order made right in front of me but no it did not happen.  They just went to a cold fridge and grabbed a pre-made Lobster Roll. One star taken off. Still gave them the benefit of the doubt to try it. Well, let's just say, I could have done it better with no experience.   Bread was not fresh and I am sure the lobster roll was half lobster and crab meat.

Another star taken off was the price.$21+, is too expensive for what I experienced and I am sure I can find a better Lobster Roll elsewhere without looking too hard.

I should take another star off because I did not get the tasting experience but a 3 star vendor is all they are worth and not h ong more.   Remember this is a tourist area.
author: Mario G.

description: Creepy guy nasty food. The guy who works there handled my money and refused to wear gloves while preparing my $17 lobster roll.
author: Annie J.

description: Was a little annoying that we had to eat outside standing up.  We were attacked by birds (seaguls).  The sandwich was just OK.  It was a cold salad.  Lobster tastes better hot.
author: Roseanne G.

description: I ordered a crab sandwich and it was probably the worst sandwich I have ever had.  The bread was hard and stale. I forced myself to try just the crab salad with a fork because it cost $10.00. Loads of mayonnaise, bordering on soupy. Also awful. I set the whole thing on top of a garbage can and watched the seagulls eat it.
author: Haley Jo B.

description: Our crab sandwich was about 98% mayonnaise, but all of the steamed shellfish options looked beyond amazing. We also got a cup of shrimp, crab, and baby shrimp which was tasted fresh and delicious. A good option to avoid paying $$$$ for seafood in the tourist area.
author: Courtney L.

description:
Nice little joint. One of the many stalls in San Francisco Wharf. The great thing about this store is that they an area in the back that you can sit it.

We decided to have their calamari and their lobster roll. It was not bad. The lobster sandwich was so big and for $20ish, it was fine. I mean, you really can't come to San Francisco without grabbing one anyway!
author: Kristie A.

description: Stopped  by here for a crab & shrimp salad for lunch...bizzy Warf location, small store seating but why sit inside when the Warf is your view on a clear Frisco day...Kool service
author: Jesse C.

description: There are several vendors selling similar items, e.g. steamed crabs/lobsters, lobster rolls, fried calamari, clam chowder... however, this place serves foods without smothering it in oil or salt. Prices are more affordable than the neighboring restaurants with servers and table cloth. There is limited seating, barely sitting perhaps ten at any given time. Definitely worth it.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Absolutely terrible. I'll never make the mistake of returning. Food was nasty and all pre made sandwiches / fried foods that had been sitting there for some time. I still bought my food after seeing it hoping the taste would outweigh the presentation and preparation but was greatly disappointed.
author: Michael H.

description:
This place is a must for me!

I enjoy the crab very much. Lines are usually long but it goes fast
author: Brad B.

description: It wouldn't feel like a weekend in San Francisco without having the classic clam chowder soup in a sourdough bread and fried calamari! This place is a typical street food stand, crowded and very casual. The staff is friendly, the food is good, the portions decent, the prices reasonable. The only criticism is that the soup was lukewarm and the calamari a little cold.
author: Kyle N.

description:
As I was exploring Fisherman's Wharf, I was a little overwhelmed by all of the options for a quick bite of seafood. I wasn't ready for a meal but couldn't leave without trying some seafood so I started to wander. This store is in a row of so many little seafood booths, I had no idea what to choose. I noticed very quickly that the crab cocktail (what I was looking for) was $7 at basically every booth. 

I pulled up my trusty Yelp app and this one seemed to have a pretty decent overall rating (every booth I found was somewhere between 3-4 stars). The setup is a little confusing if you're not used to it but I got my teeny, tiny container of crab and found a place to seat nearby (no seating inside here). The big chunks on top tasted great but when I got to the more shredded (for lack of a better term) crab meat underneath, it was...not so great. The tap was good but I found a lot of tiny pieces of shell. 

I've had much better crab meat on the east coast at a much better price. Maybe it's more fresh here but I prefer my crab meat without bits of crab shell.
author: Kristina K.

description: So good and so fresh ! I had to make a stop for breakfast before catching my plane.  It was so worth the 20 bucks
author: Carle S.

description: Ordered shrimp and chips.....again. These were delicious. I would definitely be stopping by again next time in town.
author: Eddie H.

description: Not impressed at all with this place.   Maybe I expected too much but that is what I wanted to enjoy this place and experience.   Conclusion, only the tourist and I not for the locals
author: Mario G.

description:
My husband and I run the Embarcadero a lot! We always pass these Crab Stations and the smell always leaves me hungry! I love the smell of Crab and seafood! So we decided to get a snack! 

We ordered a plate of Fried Calamari, which came with a side of cocktail sauce. It was $9.00 and it came with a lot! It wasn't as warm as I wanted it to be. But it was still good. The side of crab was ok. It didn't taste as fresh. It was a little cup for $7.00. A little overpriced. 

I would come here again to try the crab melt sandwich. It looked delicious, but also looked hard to eat because they stuff the sandwich. The place is always busy so next time we'll come in the morning when the food is still fresh!!
author: Darlene M.

description: Stopped to have a quick bite and really in the mood for crab sandwich.    This place was quick and right in the wharf.    The food was delicious.    I would eat here again for sure.
author: Craig T.

description:
I walked into the tiny restaurant that was empty. About 4 or 5pm ordered a clam chowder bread bowl and a Coca Cola (came in can) The lady was quick with bringing it out. I sat at the window. Not even 5 min. Later 2 big groups piled in about 20 ppl. No one bothered me. The food was good. But what bothered me was the window was just disgusting!! Like they just washed it down with a dirty watery towel!  A paper was posted on the window that was in a plastic sleeve it had ting fly like bugs in it!  Thank god i did not notice till I was done eating! Yuck!! The floor and the walls were just nasty with stains. I understand your busy but come on!!!! Clean the place up a little!! 

1 star for food
1 star for kind fast service
-1 star for dirty Windows 
-1 star for dirty ass walls 
-1 star for bugs in front of my face!! 

If my phone was not dead on battery when I was there I would have took photos.
author: Des T.

description: Searching for the classic chowder in a breadbowl. We came to Fisherman's wharf and there's a little restaurant row/strip of food stands. This one is nice because it has an indoor seating area while others do not. And if you want a traditional sit down restaurant in the area you're gonna pay way more for the same thing. Overall, awesome place for cheap, quick food.
author: A W.

description:
Of all places for us to pick a seafood booth to try a bowl of clam chowder we picked this station.  We ordered a plate of calamari which was pretty good.  But the clam chowder.... the minute I tasted the soup and noticed how they cut the potatoes, I told myself is this from the campbell can?  ( I know my canned soups,) 
Sure enough when one of the workers went in the kitchen. I saw boxes of huge cans of Campbell New England clam chowder!!!! Terrible.... I should've just went to a grocery store and save me couple of bucks instead of coming here! never again!
author: Ysabella V.

description: If you don't have time to sit down and eat at one of the restaurants near by and just want some San Francisco clam chowder this would be your spot. It's right on the street and ready to serve. I can't say if it was the best chowder I've had but it did the job. Being that it is on the street, you are dealing with lots of people, birds, and smells from the neighboring seafood stands and no tables to sit. You have to walk over to the pier side for some bird infested public tables. My friend got fish and chips and they weren't anything special. Just your run of the mill long john silver's frozen fish patties and stale fries. I'm not complaining because you do have choices in the area, but it was quick and easy.
author: Ivory R.

description:
This place actually serves more Shrimp than chips, unlike many other places.

The Shrimp and Chips I had, were pretty tasty. Shrimp was nicely fried and was pretty big, and the fries were nothing special but went good with it. 

Prices were OK for most of the items, but they charge an arm and a leg for a bottle of water. Service was pretty lethargic as well, but I guess that is to be expected considering they were Asian and probably get tired of dealing with questions from tourist. 

Not bad of a place!
author: Rocky B.

description: Customer service is so great! Even though it's packed and the line was long, they manage to get to us fast! The clam chowder and calamari/chips was so good! I see why it's always packed !
author: Stacy S.

description:
+/- THE FOOD
Some of the food was really good, while the others were just okay. The famous clam chowder bowl was just alright. The bread was not impressive and the chowder was way too salty. The deep fried foods (calamari and shrimp) was pretty good since it was freshly made and didn't have a lot of breading. My favorite definitely had to be the steamed crab! The meat was so juicy and flavorful. There was a lot of meat and it was so tasty!
author: Cindy C.

description: The clam chowder at this place is definitely Campbell's soup like one of the others posted said.  I personally saw them stirring a large pot of soup with the huge cans right next to it.  The calamari is frozen also.
author: Adriana V.

description:
clam chowder in a bowl! Add a crab cocktail to jazz up the chowder! yummmmmmm
No proper line, can always order on the street side if the sidewalk side has a long line! 
Expedited ordering process if you can speak Cantonese or Mandarin! 

They validate parking!
author: Christina T.

description: Crab sandwich/roll had no seasoning.  Crabcake was bland and curly fries were stale.  We did not expect much but were very disappointed.
author: Ca A.

description:
After done walking around & shopping we were about to go home so we walked toward the direction to our car & my cousin said it twice that their fried calamari are good. So I wanted something to eat or snack on since I was not satisfy from the food I order at Nick's lighthouse. after hearing my cousin saying that their fried calamari are good twice I wanted to try it out. I order the 2 item combo I got the fried clam strips & calamari. Every time I ate the fried seafood it tasted a little salty to me & I didn't like the clams but the calamari were good.
$11.75
author: Bee S.

description:
During my first visit to San Francisco this week, I spent a couple of hours walking up and down Fisherman's Wharf.  After a 6 hour flight and two hours of walking, I was famished, and a quick Yelp search brought me to The Crab Station.  

I of course ordered the famous clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl, and one crab cake.  The crab cakes looked pre-made and a little fried, but still tasted good (and it comes with free fries).  The bread bowl actually doesn't hold that much soup - so if you're hungry, you can eat the bread too.  I didn't want to fill up on bread, so unfortunately I ended up wasting the bowl.

All in all, I'd say this is a great place to stop if you're on the wharf and need a quick lunch option.  They have an area with seating behind the outdoor station if you don't want to walk and eat.
author: Dione D.

description: Fried calamari, the way it is supposed to be. These guys are packed before lunch time.
author: Czarnowski G.

description:
The Crab Station at Fisherman's Wharf, as was pointed out to me, serves a different type of Prawn (large shrimp) than their peer competitor neighbors, in that they are larger, fresher and a higher quality.  You can tell by the redness and bold thickness of the band stripes and the girth of the cooked shrimp.  (I'll include photos to illustrate how they look too).

You get 5-6 Prawns for $5.50 served cooked, peeled and cold with a side packet of oyster crackers and cocktail sauce, a nice 'lil snack, and good seafood experience for the commercialized and tourist laden Fisherman's Wharf area.

For San Francisco locals, this may not be the most convenience, cost effective or ideal place, but for tourists and visitors, it's a good spot to trust in an area with so much competition and selection so similar it's hard to differentiate and decide where to eat and who to buy from.

The parking of course is horrible in the immediate area, but also it's easy if you're willing to pay.  If you're a local, there's some secret spots in the surrounding neighborhoods and residential areas as well as cheaper paid lots.
author: Rick S.

description:
Was very disappointed with this chowder. It wasn't bad but I was expecting better. 
The fish and chips were flavorless and the only thing that had flavor was the shrimp. 
I wouldn't recommend this.
author: Kethnie M.

description:
The most affordable on the pier street. The seafood is fresh and tasty. I especially recommend lobster roll. Their clam chowder is good too. 
There is seating in small groups of 3 or less and a little on the dirty side but what do you expect from a store near the pier.
author: Naomi K.

description: Just how dare you serve frozen FAKE "Crab cakes"? You're in the CITY for God sakes. So disappointing. If that wasn't bad enough, "Shrimp stealers" (I call them) freakin swooped down and knocked all of my crispy fried shrimp on the ground as I was crossing the st. Anddddd don't even get me started on your Campbell's clam chowder! What a disgrace to the   city you guys are!
author: Jules W.

description:
Service is fast, but the place was disgusting.

The eating area was a mess with everyone's trash.  It was as if you are eating on a mountain of trash.  I recommend going into their store behind the stand outside to sit and eat.

Watch for short changing.  Know exactly how much your item costs and how much change to expect.

That said, the food was not bad.
author: Kenji Y.

description:
The must haves to be happy
when chowing seafood:

Clam chowder in bread
Calamari and shrimp
Steam crab at $13.99/lb

The End.
author: Chel R.

description: Was really excited to try our the crab station after reading all the reviews saying that the clam is really clammy here. Unfortunately the chowder did not live up to my expectation, reviews were saying that there are LOTS of clam in the sound, however, mine was mostly filled with potato and lacked flavouring. But in my opinion it is better than boudins.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I think this might be my last visit here. The food is beginning to taste mundane.

Had the breadbowl clam chowder again.
Calamari is not as crispy as I remember.
Fish & Chips is not so good.
author: Kislev A.

description:
I like the food! $9 for a crab and shrimp cocktail and $7 for a bread bowl. Not bad for the value.

I don't like how unfriendly the owner is (I assume he is the owner since he looks older than other workers). The whole time I was waiting for my food and changes, his face remained the same - indifferent, careless and no smile. As if he is a machine to sell me merchandise.
author: Emma Y.

description: It's hard to pick one stand from the few that stand at Fisherman's wharf. I didn't particularly enjoy this one greatly. The clam chowder is just a generic, plain chowder. The fried foods are pre-made, just like the places surrounding this one.
author: Christine L.

description:
Eek! Methinks not.   Gross.  If your a foodie or anyone with taste buds and you like quality food or food you can just keep down= keep it pushing! This food taste pretty bland, it almost feels like your on some episode of survivor or something--LOL. Fear factor maybe? Even though the man was nice enough to have us wait for some fresh shrimp it tasted old. The calamari= stale rubber bands. Something tells me this isn't an "off day" but an EVERYDAY @ the Crab Station!  I see a lot of tourist stop by here, especially if they have kids or like fried food.  Mainly, "The Crab Station/ Crab Station #2" looks like a safe bet, from the outside in...you might be tempted to stop through if your looking to avoid anything too risky... WELL FOLKS: Looks can be deceiving, so deceive yourself not.

I had to load up on echinacea and vitamin C the next day because my tummy felt a bit uneasy after this experience.

Nuff said.
author: Nai Q.

description:
What to order? We ordered the whole crab, yes whole. It is priced at by the pound. The one we got was about 2 pounds and was priced $15 per lb. Not much seating area and the Chinese workers, one have really bad english while another has good english. 

The crab came pretty quick and pre-cracked so it make it easier to eat. :D
author: Corie L.

description: They are using canned crab in their crab sandwich. Given that, they are still too much mayonnaiseb with theb crab meatb to bulk it up. The crab inv the sandwich smelled fishy. Crab meat that is fresh picked does not smell that way when fresh. Not worrh your money. The fish and thev clam stripsv were not that good either.
author: E M.

description:
This place is good for a stand in a super touristy area, and the best part is there is a sitting area inside where you can eat, which is better than sitting on a bench nearby spilling chowder on your lap. When I go to a place like this, there are two real items that are worthwhile:

1) chowder in a bread bowl
2) crab salad sandwich

In reality, that is the only two real reasons to come down here if you have ever been before. If you're lucky enough to take someone with you, get one of each and split it. Otherwise, I don't know how you are going to decide. 

Overall, I think there are several other places with similar quality food, but I like that you can sit down inside here and get away from a bit of the craziness outside.
author: Brent W.

description: There clam chowder was amazing. I'm a big fan of clam chowder and this place is definitely in my top 3 places I would eat at again.
author: Benjamin Z.

description: poor service, crab sandwich was full of mayo, tried to switch with lobster sandwich but cashier said had to pay again, this is definitely a tourist trap, I should have known better
author: Elle C.

description:
If you happen to be walking around the wharf because one of your group decides she needs to see Pier 39 (even if it turns out it was just to see the one-man Jack SpareRibs pirate show), and you've spent half an hour looking for parking on a busy weekend and don't feel like paying an arm and a leg at Neptune's Palace or some crap like that, walk through this alley.  You will notice that all of a sudden it sounds like everyone is speaking Mandarin.  Guess what: they are!

This particular place has all the fried seafood you can shake a crab leg at.  The fish and chips were tasty (I admit I am not a fish and chips connoisseur) and the fries good.  The fried shrimp and calamari also tasted pretty good.  They have Snapples in the fridge at the back and yes, you will change your mind and plunk down the $2 to get one midway through your meal if you didn't at the start of it.

Good luck finding a table.  You basically have to ask the guy with glasses which table is opening up next, tell him you're on deck for it and then let the whole place knows.  That's what we did.
author: Scott T.

description:
I wasn't overly impressed with the clam chowder... It was good, don't get me wrong, but was it really that much better than boudin's or any other chowder in the wharf (or what I could get from a restaurant?)... not reallly... *shrug.

Maybe my palate was off that day or the added excitement of being at the tourist trap wharf didn't add to the taste or something.  I'll have to try it again the next time I head to the wharf.
author: Anthony C.

description: Reminded me of frozen fish sticks & very stale fries. I was super excited to try the SF seafood so this was disappointing.
author: Jakara M.

description: Came here for a corn dog which was just eh. It was also $5+ which is ridiculous for a corn dog that's been sitting out for a while... The other food didn't look very appetizing either.
author: Julia M.

description: After passing by this place a few times during our stay, my boyfriend and I decided to get a few things for a snack. We ordered the shrimp & crab cocktail and the clam chowder in a bowl. The cocktail was 10 bucks but they give you a decent amount. It was good but not the best we have had. The reason for the 4 stars is based purely on the chowder! The night before we had the chowder hut which is across the street.. Let me just say that the chowder at the crab station completely blew chowder huts out of the water!!! If you're looking for good chowder at a really good price, look no further! They also had a sit down area inside which was a lot nicer than trying to find a place to sit outside!
author: Victoria C.

description:
Mmmm... my seafood lover friend and I love to come here to get crackin and get our crab grub on! We travel all the way from Vallejo, pay toll, and deal with traffic just to get our hands on these fresh, yummy crabs... or as we call them "crab braaaains" (we're not sure what to call the crab head/shell part, which is our favorite part of the crab, so we call them crab braaains"). 

When there is a line, it goes by very quick. It does get crowded especially with all the tourists, which is expected, so it can be hard to find an area or table to sit at. Sometimes we just walk over to Boudin's and crack our crabs in their outdoor seating. Yeah you can go and buy your own fresh crab in an asian supermarket for much cheaper, but unfortunately for us, we don't have any in our area, so we don't mind the drive to SF since we use the excuse to spend the rest of our day in the city. :)
author: Cindy W.

description: Their fried calamari was something I picked up in passing and it was sooooo good! Crispy light tender and perfectly season. Definitely have found a new favorite.
author: Aubrie D.

description: Convenience is a plus. It took my guy and I a while to get one of them to take our orders, they were all talking and laughing in the back. He isn't into seafood and got a corn dog, and I assume it was good since he got a second one. The calamari I ordered was undercooked and extremely chewy.
author: Gabrielle L.

description:
Shore food for the win

Food 4/5 
Typical crab lobster and other seafoods. Taste the same as all the other spots around it so kinda numbed out the uniqueness. But still good. 

Location 3/5
With so much foot traffic its hard to keep the area clean but it is street food style setting so can't complain much.

Service 3/5
Some attendants hard to understand due to language barriers. Very sales orientated atmosphere but sill can't complain since it's a street food environment.
author: Spencer H.

description:
Come here for the taste, not for anything else.

If you're just looking for a good grub you've found it.  I ordered steamed crab with basic seasonings (same way most would season at home), clam chowder and calamari.  I like my crab plain so I liked it.  Chowder is pretty good and calamari was well, calamari.  

But below are things that you will lack however, which is rather standard with these "crab stands".

- Seating 
- Service 
- Restroom (need to find a public one)
- Space (cramped)
- Wet towel (ones provided are very low quality)

Personally I wouldn't come back because of this Chinese guy that owns/works there.  Ladies were nice enough, but the guy gave me dirty looks when I asked why the crab price is unusually high.  Then when I asked for direction to a nearest public restroom, he seemed very reluctant and muttered vague directions without even looking at me.  I ended up going back to the hotel to use the restroom.
author: Oh N.

description: While perusing all of the seafood spots on the Wharf they all looked fairly similar, one after the other serving almost the exact same thing. After looking on Yelp we rolled the dice and picked the Crab Station. We had the peel and eat shrimp, fried shrimp, whole crab, and fried fish. The food was good not spectacular but for the price it was a good deal. The whole crab was  by far the best thing. They cook it in large vats of boiling water and serve it with lemon incredibly good and worth the price. There is a counter where you can stand to eat or you can go down the block to a a area that has benches. The problem with that seating area is there is always panhandlers, homeless, and people playing bad music, I'll stick to standing by the carts thanks. The other nice thing about here is that across the street is the public restroom. It is a nice clean restroom, it is the only public restroom in the area and is centrally located in a good spot.
author: Lacy C.

description: Went there at night around 8pm after driving 6 hours and hungry.  Ordered a whole crab and was being charged $35.00. Didn't haggle the price.  Found out the current price was $14.00 per lb. the next day and average weight of a crab is 1&1/2 lb.  So the average price should be just around $21.00.  Don't go to this place.  These guys are dishonest.
author: Paul C.

description: I usually come here whenever friends are visiting and want to be tourists at Fisherman's Wharf. I always order the Calamari, which is nice and crunchy. The line is sort of disorganized, so make sure they know you are there.
author: Cynthia M.

description: Clam chowder bread bowls were just okay. I felt like there were barely any clams in there, which was kind of a disappointment. But I would recommend the calamari! Fresh and delicious!!
author: Naomi R.

description: If you're looking to eat fresh seafood on a budget, this is the place.  No seating at any of these food stands but that's okay if you're alone anyway.  This is the first restaurant/meal on my recent trip to SF.  Great chowder bowl, steamed dungeness crab, shrimp cocktail.  I stood at the counter and ate while passer by (tourists) were eying my lunch.  Expect to pay around 18-20 for a freshly steamed crab.  The only thing missing on the menu is cioppino.
author: Jeremy T.

description:
I have to admit that I was lazy and didn't really read Yelp closely before I chose this place...that's a serious faux pas for me, folks...

Anyways, there are seriously 30 different options for the "famous" clam chowder you're supposed to have when you're near Pier 39 and Fisherman's wharf when you're doing the touristy thing, which I was. In any case, I skipped the large restaurants because I figured the small stands would have better food.

This place was contiguous with about 3 other places that were all selling similar things...crab, lobster rolls, chowder. Well, I went for the middle one, and bam, here is the review. 

I only got the chowder, so I can't say for anything else. It had the right flavor...I lived in Boston for 5 years, so I know how a New England clam chowder is supposed to taste. It did have the right flavor, BUT it was really lacking and clam part of it. They just needed more clam when charging $5 for a small cup.
author: James W.

description: Fake crab in the crab cakes and store-bought fries. The fried calamari was mushy and over-seasoned. Ugh!
author: Mister H.

description: Great crab sandwiches! We got a few to go to eat on the road on our way back to Idaho, I'm really glad we decided to stop here instead of some other shack on the warf.
author: Kassiah W.

description: Get a whole crab with garlic butter.  Oh. My. Freaking. Gosh.  It's absolutely amazing, and VERY reasonably priced.  You have to eat it on the street, and find a public restroom to wash your hands, but dude.  So worth it.  Trust me.
author: Sammy T.

description: Always fresh. They still make the freshest crab. This is old San Francisco, remember that, nostalgia is important. Its sea food! You are here for eats and environment. There are no upgrades here to modernize your experience. The delicious calamari and ask for fresh fries. They will bring it. Keys here is to ask the tenants. They will serve you as well. It's a treat to return here to the same thing year round and enjoy good fresh seafood.
author: Phil H.

description:
When you are in SF, clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl comes in hand and hand.  Even though I'm from San Jose, I find myself always wanting a bowl of clam chowder whenever I'm at the pier.  I tend to venture out to different places to eat per my bookmarks.  I have over 1,500 of them so I must take that into consideration when I do dine out so I can a) create new experiences, b) try a new place, c) write a review, and d) see if the place has potential to bring me back.  

Like I mentioned in my other review, my boyfriend's brother doesn't know much about other cuisines because he only knows the basic American and not much of a seafood person.  I told him that he needs to try at least one spoon because San Francisco is known for their clam chowder in a bread bowl.  BTW- per my hospitality teacher, there is something about the air in San Francisco that contributes greatly to the taste and production of the sourdough bread.  

I got 1 clam chowder in a bread bowl (he only ate 1 spoon, i ate the rest), 1 order of crab cake (comes w/ fries), an order of fries (for the boy), a beer (for the boyfriend), and a bottled water (for the brother).  The clam chowder was of course exquisite as usual.. creamy.. thick and not full of potatoes!  The sourdough was AWESOME.  If it weren't for the carbs content, I would have finished the bread bowl itself.  The crab cake was crispy, small, not flaky, not battery... very good but I wish there was more crab.  

When you're in the city and space is scarce.. buy something and enjoy it on the street.  It is seriously the best way to eat.. whilst walking so I can burn calories and consume calories simultaneously.  

Haha.
author: Tram N.

description: Best place to bring your touristy friends for San Francisco special crustacean crab treat.
author: Allen H.

description:
It's located in a tourist trap, but I went against my judgement and tried the crab station anyways.  Ordered the Shrimp & Chips $9 and a beer to help wash down the grease (as with all fried food) for $5.  

They do give a large quantity of food, but quantity is overshadowed by quality in my mouth (or stomach).  The shrimps were simply over battered and majority of the fries were over done to the point of transparency.  Good thing I ordered a beer.

I forgot to mention: the cocktail sauce (if you want to call it that) has major asian influence and is overly sweet.  it was more of like a sweet & sour sauce...no thanks.
author: Charles Y.

description: Took my 10 yr old daughter here for some much sought after crab meat ... She had been craving it for days! She was not disappointed and the price was right $8.95 +tax for a nice full portion cup (maybe 10oz cup?) of crab meat and fresh shrimp combo.  Walked across street and had a lovely bite of it under the Fisherman's Wharf sign. Quintessential San Francisco Wharf cuisine at a family friendly price.
author: Brandy L.

description: Their clam chowder had more potatoes than clams. We only had a few pieces of clam!!! Their fried calamari was cold & way too expensive and customer service was pretty rude! I am not coming back here!
author: Abigail H.

description:
5star when it's fresh. Buy during busy hours. Calamari is fresh and soft, soft! Now that's well cooked. Clam chowder is delicious. You can taste the clam!

2-3 star when it's not. Don't get the fried stuff in the morning, it's leftovers from day before or been sittin' there too long. Don't serve subpar at normal prices please.
author: Mary P.

description: Fantastic. And the service member can speak Chinese. Easy to order and ask questions if ur a Chinese.
author: Benny S.

description: There are so many choices when you're standing in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf and scrolling through the Yelp results for a chowder bread bowl. I ended up here at The Crab Station and was happy. The chowder was good, and the price was on par with the other locations on this strip. A nice safe bet for some solid clam chowder in a bread bowl.
author: Jay L.

description:
Just went there on Sunday before Memorial day. The got a stomach virus from eating their clam chowder and fried calamari. My whole family ate there and we all started vomiting heavily 2 days later. This place is gross. I never seen any of their 12 employees wear gloves or wash their hands. OH IT'S ONLY SAN FRANCISCO, A DENSELY POPULATED AREA DURING MEMORIAL DAY WEEKEND, after touching money and raw food, why wash your hands???

In short, their food literally carries Salmonella, which means that their shellfish is contaminated by sewage. Go anywhere but here. Dear god go anywhere.
author: Patrick D.

description:
Came here right before closing on a rainy Saturday! Crab was $9.95/lb! They had a cart outside their shop where you do the ordering. Got there with my mom about 9:30pm and there were few people buy crab and my mom decided that she wanted some too! My mom asked for a Big one and it cost us$22 dollars, which means the the large is a little over 2lbs.

They chop/boil/crack open the crab for you right on the spot! It took they about 10 mins to bring the crab because there were 3 crabs in front of ours. As soon as we got it my mom started to eat it before I can even take a picture! But thats ok because it was soooo nononon good that I will go back and can take a picture then. You can taste the freshness of the crab. The meat falls right off the shell and the way the crack open the shell made it really easy to eat. 

Best of all the crab was just boiled to perfection. No additional salt and pepper needed.

Note: I am not sure if its cash only but we did pay in cash.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Erhm. 

I usually like sidewalks stands, I really do! To me, they are the hole-in-the-wall type places where I can get my seafood fix. Unfortunately, Crab Station #2 didn't cut it for my taste. My mom, sister, and I only ate at Crab Station because they had indoor seating (to save us from hungry seagulls) and the prices are very similar to the other sidewalk stands. The employees are friendly, but the food is either bland or overly salty!

Calamari - This was probably one of the underwhelming calamari dishes I've ever had! Honestly, frozen calamari from Boiling Crab tastes better than the Calamari that they serve at Crab Station. 

Clam Chowder in a Sourdough bread bowl - Way too salty for my liking, but it definitely satisfied by clam chowder craving. Go to the stand next to Crab Station (sidewalk stand) as I found that their clam chowder is on the creamier side.

Crab Cocktail - This is definitely one of the better items on the menu since the crab is so juicy and fresh. 

I probably won't be back - there are much better sidewalk stands than Crab Station #2.
author: Joyce E.

description:
We were playing tourists on Pier 39 and later decided to stop by here to grab a bite to eat. The food looked good but was very underwhelming (but I'm writing this a day later so at least we didn't get sick like some people reported!).
We split a shrimp sandwich and the fried calamari and fries platter. I eat calamari often, and this just wasn't good. It was edibles, but there was absolutely no seasoning or flavor. No lemon provided, no marinara (not that I was expecting the latter). It came with a cup of cocktail sauce which didn't even taste like cocktail sauce and didn't go together with the calamari too well. The shrimp sandwich was big, but also tasteless. There was way too much mayo or something on it. I could barely finish it and not because I was stuffed.I was hoping at least the bread was sourdough, but it wasn't. Paid around $17 for both. Overall, skip this place and probably skip the stands around it as well since they all seem exactly the same.
author: Alisa Z.

description:
This was exactly what I was looking for!  
I got the Calamari and Garlic Fries.......
There really isnt much to say other than, OH MY GOSH IT WAS SO GOOD!  
Just look at the picture I took and you'll feel the same.

Plus, these guys were much nicer than the other carts.
author: Angelo F.

description: Crab was nice - not amazing - but fine. If it was a little cheaper I think I would rate it higher. The sauce they serve it with is over powering - but with the lemon wedge it was good.
author: Marcus W.

description:
I don't like seafood. At all. I don't like anything I have to peel, crack open, suck out of, or anything that requires major work when I eat. The most effort I'll put forth is maybe eatin' BBQ ribs at Phils and cuttin' steak and putting it in my mouth. However, when it comes to seafood I'm extremely lazy and super picky. Though, you're probably wonderin' why I'm review the Crab Station at Fisherman's warf...... Well, let me put it simply. 


CLAM CHOWDER IN A SOURDOUGH BREAD BOWL....... MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM.............. Absolutely one of my favorite things to eat on PLanet Earth and I could really go for one right now as my fingers are catchin' frostbite since I'm in sheer winter hell that is Shanghai, China. I can't speculate on all the other items but the the Clam Chowder in a Sourdough bread Bowl doesn't disappoint.
author: Justin Y.

description:
After having such wonderful clam chowder in a bread bowl from Tarantino's, we came back to Fisherman's Wharf to get more.  Unfortunately Tarantino's was closed, so we tried a different place.  

So utterly disappointed with this rendition of clam chowder.  It was so watery and thin.  And it tasted like old seafood and was too fishy for me to enjoy.  I tried to eat it with oyster crackers but that didn't help much. 

I'll pass next time.
author: Nancy P.

description: I always go to this station or stall or whatever you want to call it when I'm at Pier 39 and craving clam chowder in a sourdough bowl.  I went with two of my roommates for lunch today and they've never had it so they got samples from each station.  They admitted that this particular station was the best and we all got the same thing:  clam chowder in a bread bowl.  What I like about it is that it's creamy, but not overwhelmingly creamy.  It was full of flavor!  The other soups I've sampled tasted like a milk broth with chunks of clam and potatoes...  I highly recommend this stall and we got GREAT service.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
I never wrote reviews, because there are always going to be someone else who writes better review than i do on Popular places.
Not so much review for this Store, so i'm writing, and I assure you 
If the "Taste" is what you are looking for around Fisherman's Wharf

This won't be a regretful choice

I ordered a one Fresh Crab that weighted a little over a lb
When I tasted , I felt a Strike in the middle of my Brain
One of my top 3 food in SF including cellophane noodle in the Slanted Door, and Superduper Burger
It is too much for one person, and the other bad thing is that crab gets cold and if it does it loses taste, I recommended 2 or more people ordering 1 crab , Then i think it will be enough

You will Love it.

The only thing bad about this is that there is no place to eat
author: Stanley Y.

description:
I've walked by this place for years and never bothered to bat an eye. One day my BF and I decided to go out and get some real clam chowder. This place had good reviews on yelp, and they are well deserved. The service ladies are very attentive. The place is small and tight, but we went on a weekday and would never dare to come by on a weekend. The clam chowder soup was delicious. Not even close to tasting out of a can. You could tell that the flavor was fresh. 

This will now be my go to have some real clam chowder.
author: Jona C.

description:
The price is amazing considering how much seafood costs back home in DC. They are really nice and they have a nice selection of fish and dishes that they make. Everything is fresh too. I really have nothing negative to say.

The fish and chips are pretty good, but I could have done without the fries. I should just have gotten more fish. The fries are not that great, but the fish make up for it.
author: Luis D.

description: I was wanting clam chowder in a bread bowl and this place was on the way to where we were going.  I'd had some years back from one of the three or so places so I thought I was going to be ok here.  On the plus side, the bread bowl is huge and the cost is only $6.00.  The chowder was ok, nothing awesome.  With the rest of the wharf area charging over $10 and up to $15 for similar, these are the places to go.
author: Tom S.

description:
Unbeatable for the price. We got 2lbs of fresh crab, precracked (which is real nice), a clam chowder bread bowl (delicious), and a soda for $25. Staff is very friendly. No clue why this place isn't rated higher. 

For someone who loves crab, but hates the work of cracking it up piece by piece, this is the place for you!
author: Joe P.

description: I just ate a crab, it's hard to mess up a crab and they did their part. The crab was cooked fresh, it was awesome. The best part is that it was very quick.
author: Lewis B.

description: The crab was great. Haven't had a crab that good in a long time! Also, the clam chowder in the bread bowl was very tasty. Loved the sour taste of the bread.
author: Sally W.

description: This place will offer you a heated canned Campbell's clam chowder. We saw it in the kitchen and asked and they admitted it. Go to the grocery store and save your money.
author: Darío M.

description:
YES YES YES, my all time favorite meal in SF and this place hooks it up!   Not really sure were to start but the fresh cooked hole crab was the bomb, fried shrimp the sh!t, clam chowder boss, and fried calamari tasty good!

Now we may have lucked out because we got there within 15 minutes of closing but we were gifted a 2nd pint of Clam Chowder and a combo order of Calamari and shrimp for free which made our night!  The staff was extremely friendly, informative, and classy for a street fair eating experience!  

I recommend getting a bench across the street right on the bay and enjoying the experience!  Why eat anything less than fresh seafood straight from the Pacific!

Can I add a 6th star!
author: Blake L.

description: This Dodger fan enjoyed the sandwich. I was pretty pleased & surprised. The lemon kicked it up.
author: Reina C.

description:
When we went to fishermans wharf, the crab station was in a row of all clam chowder and sour dough bread stations with similar menus. All of them are standing only and a better cheaper alternative to a sit down restaurant. It was perfect since we wanted to venture around. 

I shared a bowl of clam chowder and a side of a roll of dough dough bread. It was piping hot and was hearty and thick. It is exactly how a great clam chowder should be. It was great to along with the beers they had as well to the menu. It's central to a lot of fisherman wharfs stores and attractions. I have definitely recommended to others visiting the bay area.
author: Michele S.

description: My mom and I were wandering around here and decided to stop here for a quick lunch. We fell in love with their shrimp and crab sandwiches. My mom had the shrimp sandwich and had this look of utter bliss on her face. My crab sandwich was great as well. The sweetness of the crab combined with the bread was just...well, to be honest, my mom and I still talk about those sandwiches years later. They were just so fresh and delicious.
author: Janet V.

description: This is a review of a clam chowder bread bowl and a crab sandwich: both were reasonably good, but nothing I would specifically come back here for. Bread bowl tasted like a bread bowl anywhere, clam chowder tasted like clam chowder anywhere, and the sandwich, I was expecting a hot open-faced sandwich with cheese, and what I got was a cold roll just stuffed with crab and mayo. It wasn't terrible, but while it was stuffed with crab, it was a little bland. Finding a place to sit was also a little bit tough.
author: Adam F.

description: We stopped for fried clams. Yuk!! The clams tasted like they were cooked hours before and put under heat lamps soggy and mush. Go somewhere else, what a waste of $10.00
author: David W.

description: I am gonna be fair and give them two stars because this has always been my go to place for crab. But after this last visit, I guarantee you it is my last. I am very particular when I spend money on my pleasures in life. I work hard and I like to play hard, so if I'm spending 30 bucks for crab, please have some kind of appreciation for my patronage. These people just want your money without the great service. I do not know if it is a language barrier, if they are just clueless,  or maybe they just don't give two S**** about their customers. Ordering our food, asking for condiments, asking to pack it to go was like talking in the mirror, because they look right through you. Anyway I like to always get crab to go, so I can enjoy it back at the hotel. Besides their Is no place to really sit down and enjoy this particular type of meal, on top of all the tourists and seagulls. They do crack it up just right for you, so you do not have to do much work. The crab itself is very good, but it's the wharf in San Francisco, there is fresh crab everywhere. So next time I am in town I will search for my next go to crab spot, that will appreciate my business, since the crab is the main reason I come to the Bay Area.
author: Simone T.

description: Who wants some chowda?  Well if you do want some, you may want to look elsewhere.  If you like good clam chowder and have tried some great clam chowder before, you might be disappointed by the caliber coming out of the soup pot at the Crab Station.  It was hard to find clams in our chowder and it was pretty bland.  We were one of the first ones to get a steaming hot bread bowl of chowder and it was just ok.  The sourdough wasn't toasted either.  If you're in the area and want something warm to nosh on, give it a whirl, but just don't go in with high expectations.
author: Brian G.

description:
For me, this is SF experience.  Eating (I call it street food, but not really) along the SF pier.  Dont go to the other stations which charge you more for the table.  Station 2 have their own mini place, with 3 tables & a counter you can use - for free. So you only pay for food ($12 for a whole crab, clam chowder & a beer).  Crab meats are very soft & juicy, the clam chowder is the best!

Although they have some Wet wipes, it's best to bring your own.  Better yet, go to Alioto's restroom to wash your hands which is 1 or 2 stalls away, just walk straight as if your getting a table there (when you're already full) it's  located on the 2nd floor.  Just don't tell them I sent you there. Haha!
author: Jën N.

description:
After having some food at Eagle's Cafe located in Pier 39, I was still hungry since the meal I had did not fulfill my satisfaction (2 dozen raw oysters & clam chowder bread bowl).  I walked over to Fisherman's Wharf and browsed through the food stands/vendors.  Most of the stands had pretty much the same food.  The prices were exactly the same as well.  Only thing that stood different from them was the nationality of the workers for each stand.  There was a seafood stand that had Chinese workers, a seafood stand that had Mexican workers, and a seafood stand that had Caucasian workers, etc.  I opted for the stand with Chinese workers, in which case, it's "The Crab Station".  It's not because I'm Chinese (well, I am) and wanting to support my people, but because you can eat inside their place where it's warm and cozy.  The other stands do have somewhat a place to eat, but it's out in the open, where it's cold and limited in seating.

I ordered a clam chowder in a bread bowl (Yes, I wanted it again) and fried calamari & shrimp.  It cost about $18 and man do I regret eating at Eagle's Cafe...  The only reason I ate at Eagle's Cafe was because of the free Pier 39 2 hour parking if validated at one of the selected restaurants.  Fisherman's Wharf is a great place to stop by for some seafood, especially at the stands.  I recommend bringing some hand sanitizer since it's hard to find a restroom for the public (There should be one located behind fisherman's wharf).  Also, I would bring your own water as drinks do get expensive and/or you don't want to drink anything else besides water. 

It's cheaper and better to eat here than Pier 39!

Suggestions...
Bring hand sanitizer
Bring extra napkins
Bring water bottles
Extra clothes to stay warm to eat outside!
author: Arvin C.

description:
I lived in my sorority house for a bit during college, and we had a chef with a very Italian name that none of us could pronounce correctly.  He spoke with a very heavy accent so none of us really understood him very well either, but he made delicious lunches and dinners for us (buffet-style!), so we all loved him.

One day for lunch, he made some roast turkey and cream of broccoli soup.  It was a very plain meal, but it was extremely delicious.  I had 6 bowls of soup, and for the next 6 hours, I felt like dying.  From that point on, the smell of any cream-based soups made me nauseous, and when I tried eating cream of broccoli or clam chowder, I felt like gagging.

Fast-forward 4 years and I'm living in San Francisco, land of the clam chowder.  Until this point in my life, I'd managed to do a good job of staying away from any creamy soup.  But then Boyfriend and I decided to play tourist at Pier 39 one gorgeous, warm, sunny Sunday, and all he really wanted was a bowl of clam chowder in a bread bowl at Fisherman's Wharf.

Hesitant, I told him that if he could beat me in a best-of-3 SkeeBall competition, he could pick the lunch spot and I would pay.  If I won, I'd get to choose and he'd have to foot the bill.  I ended up winning both games, but I still let him choose lunch (he actually had to pay, since I had like two dollars on me), so he picked the Crab Station.  Since he wanted the clam chowder, I went for the calamari & chips so he could have some.  I wanted to be brave and just go for the clam chowder, but I decided that Boyfriend wouldn't really want to be puked on.

The calimari came out piping hot atop a mound of fries.  In addition to the fat squid rings, there were also little baby octopus (yum!), and it was served with some marinara sauce.  It was a big order that took one and a half bowls to contain everything.

Surprisingly, I didn't hurl after tasting the clam chowder.  It was a lot less thick and sweet-creamy than the ones from the can or other restaurants, and it was actually really good, with a perfect chunk-to-broth ratio.  I was definitely a fan, although I don't think I'd get it in the bread bowl, since I didn't have any room to eat the bread once I was done having the soup.

The moral of the story.. well, there are two.  1) Although packed with tourists, Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf can actually be really fun every once in awhile.  2) Don't eat too much.
author: Tori S.

description: Mediocre. I am a big fan of seafood, but this place is nothing special. Okay for a snack kind of meal, but I'd rather go to a restaurant for a full lunch. The Chinese beer they have was really good though.
author: Viola B.

description:
My sister and I were playing tourists back in May, and against my better judgement and really wanting to have my parking validated we ate here.  Fish n Chips were not that great, my sister also ordered a cup of clam chowder, she didn't like it.  She offered it to me, and being the clam chowder lover that I am, I accepted.  Bad move, first spoonful tasted "different" and fishy.. Fast forward the next day, I am in bed with fever and etc.. for over a week!  There is nothing else that both my sister and I didn't have besides the clam chowder, she had a spoonful, I stupidly ate the whole thing.. then got sick.. kinda serves me right for going against my gut..  but oh never again! NEVER!

Update: After a visit to the doctor and lab work, the County Health Dept called to confirm I had salmonella! I had to answer all these questions about what I ate, where etc.. This place is to blame!
author: Yvette T.

description: The fried calamari and clams were so tough we couldn't eat half of what we ordered. I was disappointed because we went to this location due to its good rating on Yelp. Maybe it was a old/in fresh batch we got?? The clam chowder was decent but overall wouldn't go back. It just wasn't fresh or seasoned well :( very chewy. Hopefully we just got a bad order.
author: Sheelah P.

description:
Whenever we stopped by at Fisherman's wharf, there are many options we can go for that quick Clam chowder in a baked bread bowl. It seemed like every spots along the one block at the intersection of Jefferson and Taylor.

It was silly to come here for Clam chowder considering people on the east coast will brag they had better. On a cold windy day (when is it never a cold windy at SF?), we just had to stop by and grabbed something quick to eat. 

There were so many seafood items that are boiled in hot water to get it fresh to you. They all sound tempting especially I saw some fish and chips items at other booths. Then again you can always get that elsewhere.

We stopped by at Crab Station as it was next door to a souvenir shop in that we needed to purchase a sweater to keep ourselves warm. We then proceed to hit the outside vending shop that was set up. You pretty much can ordered any of the same quick seafood items such as sandwich items or some steamin' crab legs.

I proceeded with my order of pipin' hot clam chowder in the baked bread bowl. Not only did I slurped the soup and sucked it in like a vacuum, I also devoured the bread bowl in matter of minutes. Maybe it was the hungry nature, but it hit the spot when I needed the most.
